intro: Descurainia irio, commonly known as yellow rocket, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately divided leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The seeds are small and contained in long, slender pods, which are released when mature.
